summary: Basil II , was a Byzantine emperor from the Macedonian dynasty from January 10 976 to December 15, 1025. Under his reign, the Byzantine Empire reached its greatest height in nearly five centuries.
full_text: The Macedonian dynasty ruled the Byzantine Empire from 867 to 1056, following the Amorian dynasty. During this period, the Byzantine state reached its greatest expanse since the Muslim conquests, and the Macedonian Renaissance in letters and arts began. The dynasty was named after its founder, Basil I the Macedonian who came from the theme of Macedonia which, despite the name, was located in Thrace. The dynasty's founder was of Armenian descent, hence the dynasty is also referred to by some authors as the Armenian Dynasty.
title: Macedonian dynasty
